paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information specifically for the KCNH2 gene, including penetrance data.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: We identified 38 variants with PPA > 10% in cardiomyocyte cCREs, including previously reported variants at the KCNH2 locus.

functional_data.summary: The KCNH2 enhancer carrying the AF risk allele displayed significantly weaker enhancer activity than when containing the nonrisk variants.

variants.evidence_level: strong evidence based on functional assays and segregation data
variants.additional_notes: The KCNH2 gene is primarily expressed in ventricular and atrial cardiomyocytes in the adult human heart.
key_quotes: The cCRE appeared to be activated during hPSC-cardiomyocyte differentiation, as evidenced by an increase in H3K27ac signal that correlated with KCNH2 expression.

Results from these studies confirmed that in D15 hPSC cardiomyocytes, the KCNH2 enhancer carrying the rs7789146-G/rs7789585-G AF risk allele displayed significantly weaker enhancer activity than when containing the nonrisk variants.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data for the KCNH2 gene was extracted successfully.
